summary.snippet: "Super impressed by the ambiance, menu (food and drinks), and wait staff."
"Nice remake of this location: excellent service, nice atmosphere."
"Nice place, reasonable prices and good variety of selections."

most_relevant.description:
Sam Hill has a cool, modern atmosphere, but it was a bit empty when I visited. Everything felt fresh and new, and I can tell they put a lot of effort into the design. They have a nice outdoor space that will be perfect for summer dining.
The food was good, and they had a nice whiskey selection. I'm excited to try them out again when it's warmer and I can enjoy the patio.

Went back for a second visit and sat outside, great outdoor space. Highly recommend the smash burger.

This review is for outdoor dining on the lawn. The setting is amazing for families with kids. Great views, great games, clean, awesome seating options. The drink options were good too. Food is decent but super limited (chips and guacamole, pretzels, chicken steak tacos, hot dogs and chicken fingers and soft serve ice cream)…so if that could be expanded even a bit, this place would be 🔥 also- another suggestion to chef, please pare down the salt on all your chips!! Ty!

My girlfriends and I went here for brunch. I had looked at the menu beforehand and there was only a handful of things I would eat, since I’m picky. Most stuff had feta or stuff I didn’t want in it. I stuck with the grilled chicken sandwich and let me tell you, it was not good. It was served on Texas toast, which was too buttery and the wrong shape and size completely for the chicken. The chicken breast was thin and too small for the bread and the sandwich was doused in avacado aioli and was dripping! The chips were just ok. My friend got a grilled chicken side salad, which looked good. Other friend got the breakfast plate, said it was ok, and the other one got a pasta dish (don’t remember the name) and she said it was very good. The yard was cool with yard games and fun things. The deck outside had a shade cover which was nice since it was hot. The server was nice, but after we paid, she never came back to give us water or anything even though we were there for like another hour talking. I probably won’t be going back.

We were seated in the bar area next to dirty tables.   The food was ok and the server was ok.  We had the smash burger and the pasties (gross deep fried and don’t taste like pasties- it was more like fried dough with chopped up mushroom filling).

Great food and service!  Came here with about 10 people, had Christian as our waiter and he was excellent. Plenty of parking. We had the tomato pies (to die for), The Hot Brown (beautiful open faced sandwich), toasted ravioli, shrimp and grits with fresh big shrimp, grits were seasoned well, and the Creekside Cobb which was so good with the goat cheese. We would definitely come back for the food and the sit at the bar for cocktails. The bar is nice!

Absolutely family-friendly yard, kids love playing the games, and even making new friends. Food has been great every time. The menu is slightly limited for guests in the yard, but the atmosphere is awesome.

Burgers and fries, chicken and waffles and biscuits and gravy were all very good! The brunch cobbler drink was as well. The staff were all friendly and accommodating. We were visiting from out of town, it's always nice to find a solid go-to restaurant for future visits!

We celebrated my mother's birthday on Wednesday 10/2 at Sam Hill. Our party of 8 was promptly sat and given water. Our server was attentive, even wishing my mother a happy birthday. We had a wide range of dishes that everyone was very pleased with. I had the steak salad and the meat was seasoned and cooked perfectly to medium rare, my gf also had a salad with steak added to it that was cooked to a perfect medium, as ordered. The greens and salad components were all very fresh and it was tossed in the appropriate amount of dressing, not too much, not to little. We'll be back soon and thank you Sam Hill for a wonderful evening. Highly recommend!
